lesson: Today let me introduce you inheritance. You can declare a class B which inherit another class A. you write it this way 'A a= new B()'. But this 'B = new A()' is wrong. You have to add the instruction 'super();' in the constructor of B for the code to compile.  This is it for this POO lesson, see you for another one.

questions.question: If I declare a class A and B which extends A can I do 'A = new B();' ?
If I declare a class A and B which extends A can I do 'B = new A();' ?
You can't declare a class B which inherit another class A
You have to add the instruction 'super();' in the constructor of B for the code to compile.
